questions.question_text: Which of the following are some useful reports you can collect from Cisco ISE related to endpoints? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content:
There seems to be some confusion with this. Essentially, what klooq and Mike said is correct, the same is stated in the official SECFND 210-250, the answer is B, but it cites C:

"B. DNS was not created for tunneling, but a few tools have used it to encapsulate data in the payload of DNS packets. Threat actors have been using many different untraditional techniques to steal data from corporate networks without being detected. For example, they have been sending stolen credit card data, intellectual property, and confidential documents over DNS using tunneling."
Totally wrong! C is the correct!

choices.A: A type of VPN tunnel that uses DNS.
choices.C: DNS was not created for tunneling, but a few tools have used it to encapsulate data in the payload of DNS packets.
choices.D: An encryption tunneling protocol that uses DNSâ€™s UDP port 53.
choices.B: A type of MPLS deployment that uses DNS.

discussion.content: The answer should be transaction data

questions.question_text: Which type of data typically consists of connection level, application-specific records generated from network traffic?
